sentences.en: I won't have my son associating with skittish girls.
sentences.cn: 我不准我的儿子与轻佻的女孩交往.

sentences.en: My fellow legislators were skittish about appearing in any way be soft on crime.
sentences.cn: 我的议员同事们并不想以任何方式显露出对犯罪的手软.

sentences.en: She gets very skittish when her boy - friend is around.
sentences.cn: 她男朋友在场时,她就显得格外轻佻.

sentences.en: She is as skittish as a kitten playing with a piece of string.
sentences.cn: 她很活泼,就像一只摆弄绳子的小猫.

sentences.en: Skepticism about the Fed's willingness and ability to do all this makes Congress skittish.
sentences.cn: 由于怀疑美联储是否有意愿也有能力做好这些事情,国会的态度也时常出现变化.

sentences.en: Skittish investors are keen buyers of Germany's government paper, too, driving bond yields down.
sentences.cn: 躁动不安的投资者对德国公债的的狂热也促使了公债收益率的下滑.

sentences.en: Some skittish Wall Street investors are staying away from the market.
sentences.cn: 一些患得患失的华尔街投资者不敢入市。

sentences.en: The declining dollar gave heart to skittish investors.
sentences.cn: 美元的衰落给总是担惊受怕的投资者们带来了信心。

sentences.en: They deliberately gave me a skittish and mordacious mount.
sentences.cn: 他们故意给我一匹脾气暴躁而且还咬人的马.

sentences.en: They feared its mystery benefactor - a private company - might get skittish.
sentences.cn: 他们担心塑像的神秘赞助者 ─ ─一家私人公司 ─ ─会临时改变主意.

sentences.en: With consumers so skittish, service industries are not faring well either.
sentences.cn: 鉴于消费者如此易受波动, 服务业进展得亦不如人意.

words.tran_cn: 活泼好动；易惊；难以驾驭

trans.tran_en: a person who is skittish is not very serious, and their feelings, behaviour, and opinions keep changing
